Let us be warriors of human dignity.
On our search for a more perfect union, it‚Äôs foundational that we celebrate this and ensure our laws reflect that every person ‚Äî born and unborn ‚Äî has dignity and value.

For those of us who stand for life, we must do a better job of listening and loving.

I believe abortion is the sharpest, soul-searching question before us as a nation. It pierces every heart. People have strongly held beliefs and stories and both sides are guilty of dismissing one another.

My son Cole, now 14, was born with most common chromosomal abnormality called Down syndrome.

When he was born, doctors gave us a list of challenges and chances for heartache. I understand the uncertainty & fear. But I couldn‚Äôt imagine life without Cole. His life is worth living!

Growing up, I was never much of a baby person. I was 35 & single when I was elected to Congress. I didn‚Äôt know if becoming a mom would happen for me.

I can testify that bringing a new life into the world was the most amazing thing to ever happen to me‚Äîit‚Äôs the best part of life.
I can imagine an abortion seeming like an easy solution. It breaks my heart to think anyone would consider abortion as their only option or the best option.

I‚Äôm a pro-life mom of three ‚Äî Cole, Grace, and Brynn. For me personally, I‚Äôve never had an abortion, but I gave thought in my younger years of what I would do if I found myself pregnant and alone. It would have been a desperate situation.
